alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Franklin; Fulton; Huntingdon; Juniata; Perry; Snyder; Union (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 2:09PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN HUNTINGDON... NORTHEASTERN FRANKLIN...NORTHEASTERN FULTON...JUNIATA...SNYDER... SOUTHERN UNION...NORTHWESTERN CUMBERLAND AND PERRY COUNTIES THROUGH 245 PM EDT... At 206 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mifflinburg to 21 miles southwest of Selinsgrove to 19 miles north of Carlisle to 16 miles southeast of Lewistown to 16 miles northwest of Shippensburg to 16 miles northwest of Chambersburg. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Lewisburg, Selinsgrove, Shippensburg, Mifflinburg, Plainfield, Winfield, Shamokin Dam, Newport, Linntown, Hummels Wharf, Newville, Middleburg, Honey Grove, New Bloomfield, Mcalisterville, McClure, Kreamer, Port Trevorton, Penns Creek and Beaver Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If camping, boating or golfing, seek shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for south central and central Pennsylvania.

area.areaDesc: Cumberland; Franklin; Fulton; Huntingdon; Juniata; Perry; Snyder; Union
